reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Accelerating HIV and AIDS, Tuberculosis Prevention, Treatment, Care and Support in The Gambia

description.narrative: Gambia - TB/HIV - ActionAid International The Gambia - AAITG. This program has the following goals: To achieve zero new HIV infections, zero AIDS-related deaths and zero stigma and discrimination in The Gambia. To reduce the TB incidence rate from 174/100,000 population 139/100, 000 population by end of 2022. The objectives of this program are: To reduce new HIV infections by 50% in the general population by 2019 (Currently the NSP is under review and the Objectives will be extended to 2020). To reduce new HIV infections by 50% among key population by 2019 (Currently the NSP is under review and the Objectives will be extended to 2020). To reduce mother to child transmission of HIV at 6 weeks from 10% to 3% by 2019 (Currently the NSP is under review and the Objectives will be extended to 2020). To increase the coverage of antiretroviral therapy from 21% to 90% of all persons living with HIV by 2019 (Currently the NSP is under review and the Objectives will be extended to 2020). To double the percentage of people showing acceptable attitudes toward people living with HIV by 2019 (Currently the NSP is under review and the Objectives will be extended to 2020). To detect at least 95% of all TB Patients (universal access) within 1-2 weeks of onset of symptoms by 2017.. To achieve and sustain a treatment success rate of at least 95% from a baseline of 88% in 2013 for all new patients by 2017.. To increase the proportion of children under 15 with TB notified to the NLTP from the current 5% (2016) to 10% by 2022. To increase the proportion of HIV testing among TB patients from 88% to 100% by 2022. To test 95% of retreatment cases and contacts of DR-TB by 2022

title.narrative: Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
